abstract: Citigroup‘s chairman, Richard D. Parsons, said Monday that the bank expected to pay back the $45 billion it borrowed from the government’s banking bailout program, but that it had no timetable for doing so.
snippet: Citigroup‘s chairman, Richard D. Parsons, said Monday that the bank expected to pay back the $45 billion it borrowed from the government’s banking bailout program, but that it had no timetable for doing so.
lead_paragraph: Citigroup‘s chairman, Richard D. Parsons, said Monday that the bank expected to pay back the $45 billion it borrowed from the government’s banking bailout program, but that it had no timetable for doing so.

headline.main: Citi’s Chairman Sees No Timetable for Repaying TARP
